desc: Returns whether this vehicle has a brake pedal. See {{ClassFunction|Vehicle|SetHasBrakePedal}}.

name: IsBoosting
desc: Returns whether this vehicle is currently boosting or not.

name: IsEngineEnabled
desc: Returns whether the engine is enabled or not, i.e. whether it can be started.

name: IsEngineStarted
desc: Returns whether the engine is started or not.

name: IsValidVehicle
desc: Returns true if the vehicle object is a valid or not. This will return false when Vehicle functions are not usable on the vehicle.

name: IsVehicleBodyInWater
desc: Returns whether this vehicle's engine is underwater or not. ( Internally the attachment point "engine" or "vehicle_engine" is checked )

name: SetBoost
desc: Sets the boost. It is possible that this function does not work while the vehicle has a valid driver in it.

name: SetCameraDistance
desc: Sets the third person camera distance of the vehicle.

name: SetHasBrakePedal
desc: Sets whether this vehicle has a brake pedal.

name: SetMaxReverseThrottle
desc: Sets maximum reverse throttle

name: SetMaxThrottle
desc: Sets maximum forward throttle

name: SetSpringLength
desc: Sets spring length of given wheel

name: SetSteering
desc: Sets the steering of the vehicle.

name: SetSteeringDegrees
desc: Sets the maximum steering degrees of the vehicle

name: SetThirdPersonMode
desc: Sets the third person mode state.

name: SetThrottle
desc: Sets the throttle of the vehicle. It is possible that this function does not work with a valid driver in it.

name: SetVehicleClass
desc: {{Internal}}Sets the vehicle class name.

name: SetVehicleEntryAnim
desc: Sets whether the entry or exit camera animation should be played or not.

name: SetVehicleParams
desc: Sets the vehicle parameters for given vehicle.

name: SetWheelFriction
desc: Sets friction of given wheel. {{Validate}} This function may be broken.

name: StartEngine
desc: Starts or stops the engine.

name: GetField
desc: Returns a specific field in the matrix.

name: GetInverse
desc: Returns an inverted matrix without modifying the original matrix.

name: GetInverseTR
desc: Returns an inverted matrix without modifying the original matrix. This function will not fail, but only works correctly on matrices that contain only translation and/or rotation.

name: GetTranslation
desc: Returns the absolute translation of the matrix.

name: Identity
desc: Initializes the matrix as Identity matrix.

name: Invert
desc: Inverts the matrix.

name: InvertTR
desc: Inverts the matrix. This function will not fail, but only works correctly on matrices that contain only translation and/or rotation.

name: IsIdentity
desc: Returns whether the matrix is equal to Identity matrix or not.

name: IsRotationMatrix
desc: Returns whether the matrix is a rotation matrix or not.

name: Scale
desc: Scales the matrix by the given vector.

name: ScaleTranslation
desc: Scales the absolute translation with the given value.

name: Set
desc: Copies values from the given matrix object.

name: SetField
desc: Sets a specific field in the matrix.

name: SetForward
desc: Sets the forward direction of the matrix.

name: SetRight
desc: Sets the right direction of the matrix.

name: SetScale
desc: Modifies the scale of the matrix while preserving the rotation and translation.

name: SetTranslation
desc: Sets the absolute translation of the matrix.

name: SetUp
desc: Sets the up direction of the matrix.

name: ToTable
desc: Converts the matrix to a 4x4 table. See {{GlobalFunction|Matrix}} function.

name: Translate
desc: Translates the matrix by the given vector aka. adds the vector to the translation.

name: AllowsAutoSwitchFrom
desc: Returns whether the weapon allows to being switched from when a better ( {{ClassFunction|Weapon|GetWeight}} ) weapon is being picked up.

name: AllowsAutoSwitchTo
desc: Returns whether the weapon allows to being switched to when a better ( {{ClassFunction|Weapon|GetWeight}} ) weapon is being picked up.

name: CallOnClient
desc: Calls a SWEP function on client.

name: Clip1
desc: Returns how much primary ammo is in the magazine.

name: Clip2
desc: Returns how much secondary ammo is in magazine.

name: DefaultReload
desc: Forces the weapon to reload while playing given animation.

name: GetHoldType
desc: Returns the hold type of the weapon.

name: GetMaxClip1
desc: Returns maximum primary clip size

name: GetMaxClip2
desc: Returns maximum secondary clip size

name: GetNextPrimaryFire
desc: Gets the next time the weapon can primary fire. ( Can call {{HookFunction|WEAPON|PrimaryAttack}} )

name: GetNextSecondaryFire
desc: Gets the next time the weapon can secondary fire. ( Can call {{HookFunction|WEAPON|SecondaryAttack}} )

name: GetPrimaryAmmoType
desc: Gets the primary ammo type of the given weapon.

name: GetPrintName
desc: Returns the non-internal name of the weapon, that should be for displaying.

name: GetSecondaryAmmoType
desc: Gets the ammo type of the given weapons secondary fire.

name: GetSlot
desc: Returns the slot of the weapon (slot numbers start from 0)

name: GetSlotPos
desc: Returns slot position of the weapon

name: GetWeaponViewModel
desc: Returns the view model of the weapon.

name: GetWeaponWorldModel
desc: Returns the world model of the weapon.

name: GetWeight
desc: Returns the "weight" of the weapon, which is used when deciding which Weapon is better by the engine.

name: HasAmmo
desc: Returns whether the weapon has ammo left or not. It will return false when there's no ammo left in the magazine '''and''' when there's no reserve ammo left.

name: IsCarriedByLocalPlayer
desc: Returns whenever the weapon is carried by the local player.

name: IsScripted
desc: Checks if the weapon is a SWEP or a built-in weapon.

name: IsWeaponVisible
desc: Returns whether the weapon is visible. The term visibility is not exactly what gets checked here, first it checks if the owner is a player, then checks if the active view model has EF_NODRAW flag NOT set.

name: LastShootTime
desc: Returns the time since this weapon last fired a bullet with {{ClassFunction|Entity|FireBullets}} in seconds.

name: SendWeaponAnim
desc: Forces weapon to play activity/animation.

name: SetClip1
desc: Lets you change the number of bullets in the given weapons primary clip.

name: SetClip2
desc: Lets you change the number of bullets in the given weapons secondary clip.

name: SetHoldType
desc: Sets the hold type of the weapon. This function also calls {{HookFunction|WEAPON|SetWeaponHoldType}} and properly networks it to all clients.

name: SetLastShootTime
desc: Sets the time since this weapon last fired in seconds. Used in conjunction with {{ClassFunction|Weapon|LastShootTime}}.

name: SetNextPrimaryFire
desc: Sets when the weapon can fire again. Time should be based on {{GlobalFunction|CurTime}}.
